SENSES.SENSE: something that a computer, printer, etc. does<font color=blue> ex: Your scan is the third job in the queue. </font>
your duty in a particular situation or organization<font color=blue> ex: When I took on the job, I didn't know what it would involve. </font>
something that you have to do or deal with<font color=blue> ex: Our architects have done the job in record time. </font>

work that you do regularly to earn money . When you ask someone about their job, you usually say "What do you do?", and not "What is your job?" The answer would usually be "I am a ..." or "I work as a...", and not "My job is..."<font color=blue> ex: There are not many job opportunities in this part of the country. </font>
a crime, especially one in which money is stolen<font color=blue> ex: a bank job </font>
something of a particular type<font color=blue> ex: He's bought one of those MP3 jobs. </font>
